sen.j: 正親町 実連（おおぎまち さねつら、享保5年7月23日 (旧暦)（1720年8月26日） - 享和2年9月29日 (旧暦)（1802年10月25日））は、江戸時代中期の公家。
sen.e: Sanetsura OGIMACHI (August 26, 1720 - October 25, 1802) was Kuge (court noble) of the middle of Edo period.
sen.cmt: 原文には２箇所 (旧暦) とありますが、リンク先の単語が抽出されるバグのようですので、訳出しておりません。
sen.e: Sanetsura OGIMACHI (August 26, 1720 - October 25, 1802) was Kuge (court noble) of the middle of Edo period.
Sanetsura OGIMACHI (August 26, 1720 - October 25, 1802) was Kuge (court noble) of the middle of Edo period.

sen.j: 主に桃園天皇（116代）・後桜町天皇（117代）の二代に仕えた。
sen.e: He mainly served the two emperors: Emperor Momozono (116th) and Empress Gosakuramachi (117th).
He mainly served the two emperors: Emperor Momozono (116th) and Empress Gosakuramachi (117th).
He mainly served the two emperors: Emperor Momozono (116th) and Empress Gosakuramachi (117th).

sen.j: 権大納言の正親町公通の末子である。
sen.e: He was the youngest child of Gon Dainagon (a provisional chief councilor of state) Kinmichi OGIMACHI.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was the youngest child of Gon Dainagon (a provisional chief councilor of state) Kinmichi OGIMACHI.
He was the youngest child of Gon Dainagon (a provisional chief councilor of state) Kinmichi OGIMACHI.

sen.j: 兄達が若くして死んだり、他の公家に養子に入るなどしたため、正親町家の家督を継いだ。
sen.e: Since some of his older brothers died young and others were adopted into other kuge families, he took over as the head of OGIMACHI family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処2名が若くして死に、3名が養子となっているためどちらも複数形にしました。http://www.weblio.jp/content/%E6%AD%A3%E8%A6%AA%E7%94%BA%E5%85%AC%E9%80%9A
sen.e: Since some of his older brothers died young and others were adopted into other kuge families, he took over as the head of Ogimachi family.
sen.cmt: 家名は頭文字のみ大文字で表記します。
sen.e: Since some of his older brothers died young and others were adopted into other kuge families, he took over as the head of Ogimachi family.

sen.j: 享保17年（1732年）に叙任し、侍従となる。
sen.e: He was appointed to Jiju (a chamberlain) in 1732.
He was appointed to Jiju (a chamberlain) in 1732.
He was appointed to Jiju (a chamberlain) in 1732.

sen.j: 享保20年（1735年）に従五位上に昇進するとともに元服。
sen.e: In 1735, he was promoted to Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) and reached manhood at the same time.
In 1735, he was promoted to Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) and reached manhood at the same time.
In 1735, he was promoted to Jugoinojo (Junior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) and reached manhood at the same time.

sen.j: その後、逐次昇進して、近衛府、近衛府、丹波国、播磨国、蔵人頭などを歴任した。
sen.e: He was promoted through the ranks, successively filling the posts of Sakone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), Ukone no chujo (Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), Tanba no suke (assistant governor of Tanba Province), Harima no Gon no suke (provisional vice governor of Harima Province), Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain) and so on.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処原文には「近衛府、近衛府、丹波国、播磨国」 とありますが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「左近衛少将、右近衛中将、丹波介、播磨権介」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出しました。
sen.e: He was promoted through the ranks, successively filling the posts of Sakone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), Ukone no chujo (Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), Tanba no suke (assistant governor of Tanba Province), Harima no Gon no suke (provisional vice governor of Harima Province), Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain) and so on.

He was promoted through the ranks, successively filling the posts of Sakone no shosho (Minor Captain of the Left Division of Inner Palace Guards), Ukone no chujo (Middle Captain of the Right Division of Inner Palace Guards), Tanba no suke (assistant governor of Tanba Province), Harima no Gon no suke (provisional vice governor of Harima Province), Kurodo no to (Head Chamberlain) and so on.

sen.j: 寛延3年（1750年）に従三位参議となり、公卿に列した。
sen.e: In 1750 he took office as Jusanmi Sangi (councilor in the Junior Third Rank) and ranked among Kugyo (the top court officials).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: In 1750 he took office as Jusanmi Sangi (councilor in the Junior Third Rank) and ranked among Kugyo (the top court officials).
In 1750 he took office as Jusanmi Sangi (councilor in the Junior Third Rank) and ranked among Kugyo (the top court officials).

sen.j: また同年、踏歌節会外弁をつとめている。
sen.e: In the same year he served as Toka no sechie Geben (a kugyo who supervised many matters outside Jomei Gate at Toka no sechie [Imperial Court Ceremony]).
In the same year he served as Toka no sechie Geben (a kugyo who supervised many matters outside Jomei Gate at Toka no sechie [Imperial Court Ceremony]).
In the same year he served as Toka no sechie Geben (a kugyo who supervised many matters outside Jomei Gate at Toka no sechie [Imperial Court Ceremony]).

sen.j: 宝暦3年（1753年）中納言に叙任し、翌年には正三位となった。
sen.e: He was appointed to Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state) in 1753, then moved up to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) the next year.
sen.cmt: 原文には「中納言」 とありますが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「権中納言」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出しました。
sen.e: He was appointed to Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state) in 1753, then moved up to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) the next year.
He was appointed to Gon Chunagon (a provisional vice-councilor of state) in 1753, then moved up to Shosanmi (Senior Third Rank) the next year.

sen.j: さらに宝暦6年（1756年）に大納言となり、宝暦12年（1762年）までつとめた。
sen.e: He won another promotion to Gon Dainagon (a provisional chief councilor of state) in 1756 and remained in office until 1762.
sen.cmt: 原文には「大納言」 とありますが、リンク先の単語のようです。ウェブで確認すると用語が「権大納言」となっており、本来はこちらの用語を使用していると思われますので、こちらを訳出しました。
sen.e: He won another promotion to Gon Dainagon (a provisional chief councilor of state) in 1756 and remained in office until 1762.
He won another promotion to Gon Dainagon (a provisional chief councilor of state) in 1756 and remained in office until 1762.

sen.j: 安永8年（1779年）に従一位に昇る。
sen.e: In 1779 he moved up to Juichii (Junior First Rank).
In 1779 he moved up to Juichii (Junior First Rank).
In 1779 he moved up to Juichii (Junior First Rank).
He died in 1802.
He died in 1802.
He died in 1802.
Age at death: 83.
Age at death: 83.
Age at death: 83.

sen.j: 家督は子の正親町公明が継いだ。
sen.e: The family estate was inherited by his son Kinaki OGIMACHI.
The family estate was inherited by his son Kinaki OGIMACHI.
The family estate was inherited by his son Kinaki OGIMACHI.

sen.j: 父公通同様、狂歌を好んだ人物だった。
sen.e: Similarly to his father Kinmichi, he was fond of Kyoka (comic Tanka [thirty-one syllables' poem]).
Similarly to his father Kinmichi, he was fond of Kyoka (comic Tanka [thirty-one syllables' poem]).
Similarly to his father Kinmichi, he was fond of Kyoka (comic Tanka [thirty-one syllables' poem]).
